description: This file contains utility functions and configuration checks for environment variables related to search providers, CORS settings, and authentication modes in a startup/initialization context. It includes functions for safely parsing environment variables, detecting API keys, and logging the current environment configuration for diagnostics. The module is designed to be side-effect free upon import and can be run standalone for manual validation.

methods.name: bool _env_bool(name: str, default: bool = False)
methods.description: Safely parses a boolean-like environment variable without raising exceptions, returning a default if parsing fails.

methods.name: List[str] _env_list(name: str, default: Optional[List[str]] = None)
methods.description: Safely parses a comma-separated list environment variable, returning a default list if parsing fails.

methods.name: str _effective_search_provider()
methods.description: Returns the normalized (lowercase) search provider specified in environment variables or 'auto' by default.

methods.name: bool _has_bing_key()
methods.description: Checks for presence of a Bing API key or Search API key environment variable.

methods.name: bool _should_require_bing_key(provider: str)
methods.description: Determines whether a Bing API key should be required based on the current search provider setting.

methods.name: None validate_environment()
methods.description: Logs current environment configuration for diagnostics, including CORS settings, search provider, API key presence, and auth mode.
